title: The Hundred draft: Who has entered, what are the prices and how will it work?
text:
The Hundred teams will select their squads at this weekend’s draft (Picture: Getty)

A major step towards next summer’s The Hundred competition will be taken on Sunday when the eight teams select their squads at the draft.

Almost 600 domestic and international players have entered the draft, hoping to secure lucrative contracts at one of the city-based teams for the inaugural running of The Hundred.

The eight teams – London Spirit, Oval Invincibles, Southern Brave, Welsh Fire, Birmingham Phoenix, Trent Rockets, Manchester Originals and Northern Superchargers – have been officially unveiled and will now look to create squads capable of becoming the first Hundred champions.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

First of all, what is The Hundred?

Advertisement

Advertisement

A new competition masterminded by the England and Wales Cricket Board which will see eight freshly formed teams, representing seven cities from around the UK, compete against each.

Each team has a men’s and women’s team.

What are the teams?

London Spirit (London, Lord’s)

Oval Invincibles (London, The Oval)

Southern Brave (Southampton, The Ageas Bowl)

Welsh Fire (Cardiff, Sophia Gardens)

Birmingham Phoenix (Birmingham, Edgbaston)

Trent Rockets (Nottingham, Trent Bridge)

Manchester Originals (Manchester, Old Trafford)

Northern Superchargers (Leeds, Headingley)

How will the matches look?

The Hundred format 100 balls per innings (most runs wins)

A change of ends after 10 balls

Bowlers deliver either five or 10 consecutive balls

Each bowler can deliver a maximum of 20 balls per game

Each bowling side gets a strategic timeout of up to two and a half minutes

A 25-ball powerplay start for each team

Two fielders allowed outside of the 30-yard circle during the powerplay



When will it be played?

The competition will be played during the school summer holidays, from July 17 to August 16. There will be 32 group matches in the men’s tournament.

The top three teams will progress to Finals Day, with the group winner advancing straight to the final and the two other sides facing each other in a semi-final.

Will England’s Test stars be involved?

Yes, and they’ve already been assigned to teams. Each side has also been given two local ‘icon’ players.

The Hundred teams so far London Spirit: Rory Burns, Eoin Morgan, Dan Lawrence Oval Invincibles: Sam Curran, Jason Roy, Tom Curran Southern Brave: Jofra Archer, James Vince, Chris Jordan Welsh Fire: Jonny Bairstow, Tom Banton, Colin Ingram Birmingham Phoenix: Chris Woakes, Moeen Ali, Pat Brown Trent Rockets: Joe Root, Alex Hales, Harry Gurney Manchester Originals: Jos Buttler, Matt Parkinson, Saqib Mahmood Northern Superchargers: Ben Stokes, Adil Rashid, David Willey

Who has entered the draft and what’s the deal with pricing?

Advertisement

Advertisement

Almost 600 players have registered for the draft, including the likes of Chris Gayle, David Warner, Rashid Khan, Trent Boult and Steve Smith.

There are seven different salary bands and two players will be picked from each of the following: £125,000, £100k, £75k, £60k, £50k, £40k and £30k.

The majority of the players who entered the draft did so without a reserve price, meaning they could be picked up for a minimum £30,000 or secure much larger contracts.

How will the draft work?

A pre-draft draw has assigned each team a position from one to eight. They will make their picks in this order before the order is reversed for the second picks, and so on.

Trent Rockets will be the first team to select a player and be followed by Southern Brave, Northern Superchargers, Welsh Fire, Oval Invincibles, Manchester Originals, London Spirit and finally Birmingham Phoenix.

This process will go on for seven rounds until each squad contains 15 players.

The Hundred will take place next summer (Picture: Getty)

There is a set value for the players in each round, starting at £125,000 and finishing with a minimum value of £30k.

Each team will spend £990,000 on salaries for their squad, although £30k will need to be saved for a ‘wild card’ selection, which will be named shortly before the tournament starts.

Teams are permitted to select a maximum of three overseas players and there is no limit on the number of players from any one county or country.

Who is making the decisions?

It is up to the coaches of each team and their analysts to select the squads. Among the coaches are Australia legend Shane Warne and Sri Lanka hero Mahela Jayawardene.

Shane Warne is one of the coaches for The Hundred (Picture: Getty)

When is The Hundred draft and how can I follow?

Advertisement

The draft will take place on Sunday evening (October 20) at 7pm.

It will be televised live on Sky Sports Cricket and Sky Sports Main Event. Metro.co.uk will be on hand with all the breaking news and reaction from players and coaches.

What about the women’s draft?

Two women have already been signed by each franchise, with the remaining 13 spaces in their squads selected across three different player pools: the remaining England players, overseas players and domestic players.

Each team has the chance to sign one more England centrally contracted player and three overseas stars.

In the women’s competition, the salary brackets range from £15,000 to £3,600.
